abstract: New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo rejects proposal to meet with Transportation Sec Anthony Foxx about possibility of a federal loan to finance new train tunnels between New Jersey and New York City; governor argues that neither state can afford to pay back a loan of the magnitude needed for the project, and asserts that without concession that a federal grant is in order, any discussion is pointless.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo said a meeting proposed by the federal transportation secretary would be pointless if the United States insisted that New York and New Jersey had to pay back loans to start a tunnel project.

headline.main: Cuomo Says Hudson Tunnels Need Grants, Not Loans to States, From U.S.
headline.print_headline: Cuomo Says Hudson Tunnels Need Grants From U.S., Not Loans to States

snippet: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo said a meeting proposed by the federal transportation secretary would be pointless if the United States insisted that New York and New Jersey had to pay back loans to start a tunnel project.
